content: Currently sitting at roughly 1500 respondents in the English language survey - will update other languages as have time. (And it looks like the majority are completing the entire survey!)
@Jasun Carr I wanted to ask how do you want organise and categorise the feedback once the survey period is over?

Once the survey is over, the biggest help I'll need is folks to translate the open ended question responses into English, and for the folks who did the Chinese version to share the results with me. I have access to the other surveys, and will be able to pull those down off of Google, add a language variable, and combine them before cleaning the data and beginning the analysis. (I'll actually start on this before the survey closes, just to be more efficient.)
Last I checked we were over 2,000 responses, which is great

Current #'s (apologies if I mis-ident any language - I'm just going off of the 2-letter codes):
English: 2700
Spanish: 21
German: 94
Vietnamese: 6
Russian: 86
Traditional Chinese: 0 (though there is also simplified Chinese version on QQ that I don't have access to)
Swedish: 0
Korean: 0
French: 0
Japanese: 0
Polish: 0
Italian: 0
Hindi: 0

Total: 2909 !!!!!
@Jasun Carr there's traditional chinese (the one in google forms) and simplified chinese (the one in qq forms)
cc @Xidorn Quan how many replies do we have for now in QQ forms?
Can I just say, as a person who's done surveys for over a decade, I've NEVER seen completion rates like this. The dedication and interest of the community is amazing.
